title: 112_hr6203
content: The Act titled "Protect Our Schools from Tax Delinquents Act of 2012" requires owners of assisted units to stay current on local property and school taxes. The "Protect Our Schools from Tax Delinquents Act of 2012" mandates that owners of assisted units must pay all local property and school taxes on time. Housing assistance contracts must include this obligation for owners. The "Protect Our Schools from Tax Delinquents Act of 2012" requires owners of assisted dwelling units to pay all local property and school taxes on time. If a delinquency occurs, the public housing agency must stop assistance until the delinquent taxes are paid, and transfer monthly assistance amounts to the taxing authority until the issue is resolved. The Secretary will establish requirements for housing assistance payments contracts to address delinquencies in property taxes, ensuring that payments are only transferred for confirmed taxes owed by the owner of a dwelling unit. The Secretary will maintain a database of owners of assisted dwelling units whose contracts were terminated for not complying with tax payment requirements. This section does not allow the termination of tenant leases in these units. The Secretary will maintain a database of owners of assisted dwelling units whose contracts were terminated for not complying with tax payment requirements. The database will include information on owners, properties, transferred amounts, and the period of abatement and transfer. Public housing agencies must submit information for the database. The Secretary will maintain a database of owners of assisted dwelling units whose contracts were terminated for not complying with tax payment requirements. Definitions for covered taxes and taxing authority are provided. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development will issue necessary regulations for section 8(o)(21). The Secretary will issue regulations for section 8(o)(21) of the United States Housing Act of 1937.
